revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=E2500 |revision=v1 |upc=745883592371 |ean= |asin=B004T9RR4A |price= |est_release_date=04/04/2011 |fcc_date=03/04/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=CyberTAN |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-E2500 |ic_id=3839A-E2500 |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM5358UB0;BCM5357B0KFBG, HG1037 P20, 998047 N1 W; |cpu1_cspeed=300 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM5358UB0;BCM5357B0KFBG, HG1037 P20, 998047 N1 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43236 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags= |tp_firmware=Tomato (Shibby), Tomato RAF (Victek), Tomato (Hyzoom), |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui=20:AA:4B, 58:6D:8F, C0:C1:C0 |oui_eth=20:AA:4B, 58:6D:8F, C0:C1:C0 }} '''Advanced Dual-Band N Router'''
{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=E2500}}
The serial number appears to start with '''10A10'''.
{{TechInfoDepot|Linksys_E2500_v1}} :Chip marking data is per the images hosted on ''TechInfoDepot''
*[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31578-cisco-linksys-e2500-advanced-dual-band-n-router-reviewed Reviewed on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :"3763-30000302R" or "3763-30000303R" is silkscreened on the board.
*[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=140536 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] :C0:C1:C0 OUI and 300MHz CPU in the boot log
The E2500v1 would [http://tomato.groov.pl/?page_id=69 appear to be <small>experimentally</small> supported by ''Shibby'''s '''Tomato''' RT-N builds].
The E2500v1 is [http://victek.is-a-geek.com] supported. Victek RAF versions.
